title: ESP32 Flasher Troubleshooting Guide
description: Encountering connection issues or timing errors? This guide covers the most common flashing problems and their solutions.
author: sddionOS Dev

contentBlocks.text: Sometimes, hardware communication can be tricky. If you're having trouble connecting to your ESP32, follow these common troubleshooting steps.

contentBlocks.title: Entering Bootloader Mode
contentBlocks.text:
If the tool fails to connect with a 'Failed to connect' error, you likely need to put your ESP32 into **Bootloader Mode** manually:

1. Hold down the **BOOT** button on your board.
2. Quickly press and release the **EN** (or **RST**) button.
3. Release the **BOOT** button.
4. Try clicking **Connect** again.

contentBlocks.title: Browser Compatibility
contentBlocks.text: Ensure you are using a **Chromium-based browser**. Firefox and Safari currently do not support the Web Serial API. Look for the 'Web Serial API not supported' warning in the app header.

### 3. Cable & Port Issues
- **Power-only cables**: Many cheap micro-USB cables only provide power. Ensure you are using a **Data cable**.
- **Driver Issues**: On Windows, you might need drivers for the USB-to-Serial chip (CP210x or CH340).

contentBlocks.title: Baud Rate Mismatch
contentBlocks.text: If you see 'garbage' characters in the console, your baud rate is likely incorrect. Try switching between **115200** and **9600** to see if communication stabilizes.
